title: Rafa Benitez offers positive update on Rolando Aarons - and reveals extent of Ciaran Clark's injury
text:

Rolando Aarons is making a quicker-than-expected recovery from his cruciate-ligament injury - and Newcastle United remain hopeful that the winger could yet feature again this season. 
The 21-year-old broke a bone in his foot in August and, after a three-month lay-off, was due to feature in November before he ruptured his anterior cruciate knee ligament in training. 
Normally such an injury would sideline a play for between six to eight months, but Aarons is back in full training - and keen to finally put his injury nightmare behind him. 
Though Rafa Benitez will not rush Aarons - who made five appearances in August before his original foot injury - back into action, the United boss is hopeful that the winger could play a part during Newcastle’s final eight games of the season, or at the very least for the Under-23s. Rolando Aarons during a Newcastle United Training Session (Photo: Newcastle United) 
Benitez explained: “Rolando we have been speaking about a lot, because usually you expect from a cruciate-ligament injury for it to be six to eight months, but for Rolando after four months he is now doing full training sessions with the team. 
“We are really pleased with him but we don’t want to take any risks because we don’t have too many games left, so we will see and we will monitor him every day and see how he feels. 
“Then we can decide if he can play with the Under-23s or whatever, but we will not rush because we don’t need to and we don’t want to take the risk.” 
Isaac Hayden has recovered from his ankle injury and is in the squad to take on Wigan Athletic on Saturday, while Daryl Murphy and Grant Hanley could feature if they pass late assessments. Read More Rafa Benitez's Press conference Q&A: All you need to know as Newcastle boss sets sights on Wigan 
Ciaran Clark, Jamie Sterry and DeAndre Yedlin remain unavailable, however. 
“Hanley and Murphy had little problems, they have been working with the physios and fitness coaches though and they have been training. 
“We have to decide if they can play or not but both have been training.” 
Clark suffered medial-ligament damage earlier this month and missed Newcastle’s trip to Birmingham City. 
Though the Irishman is not fit enough to face Wigan, Benitez hopes to have the centre-back available again within a week or so. 
“It’s not very bad but still he has a little bit of discomfort and he has to carry on progressing,” Benitez said of Clark’s injury. 
“With the medial ligament you can have problems when you turn and when you kick the ball with your toes. 
“We just need to be sure that he can turn properly, so it’s just a question of time. Read More Will Newcastle United's recruitment be affected by Brexit? New calls for football to be 'exempt' 
“Maybe days, or one week or something like this. 
“I will not give a time but he is improving well and it’s just about him having 100-per-cent confidence when kicking.” Like us on Facebook
